website_summaries.verdict: Suitable for most fires a homeowner could potentially encounter, and the price is right.
pros: Users appreciate its quick extinguishing power for everything from grease fires to outdoor fires
cons: 2.5 pounds of extinguishing agent is not enough for bigger fires

customer_reviews.title: great price but one came barely on the bottom of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, great price but one came barely on the bottom of the charged line. I read online to take it to any fire department and they would be able to recharge it for about $10-15 yet when I asked they said it's actually more expensive to recharge than to just buy a new one. I encourage you to check the charge when you receive it and return it if it is not over have charged at least.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Great Price for a 'Real' Unit
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and paid for one but was shipped two...not sure why. I hope I never have to use it but this unit looks like it would actually work compared to those little plastic 'one time' units. This one has a solid metal mechanism that does not look like it is going to break during the 'excitement' of a fire (the smaller units seem to have an all plastic mechanism). This unit is also rechargeable. The advise from a fire-fighter friend is that you don't need to have the most expensive extinquisher but having the cheapest unit that might break before you get a chance to use it is not a good idea. This unit is the perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: Benzimidazolone

customer_reviews.title: Arrived discharged and dust everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: This came completely discharged when I took it out of the box. I didn't need to look at the gauge to even know. When I picked up the actual box out of the Amazon box, it was covered it yellow dust and was leaking out of the corner. It got everywhere! The gauge also registered as needing to be refilled. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Butcher Family

customer_reviews.title: Saved Our Home
customer_reviews.text: I never expected to have to use this, but we unexpectedly had to earlier this week. We had a very suspicious trash fire set early in the morning. This truly did save my home from going up in flames! My son helped put the fire out and his complaint was there isn't as much in it as he had hoped. Thankfully, we had it on hand or we would have lost so much more than our back patio. Yes this works and does save lives. I would highly recommend it, but don't expect to put out a massive fire with this sized extinguisher.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Gives me peace of mind!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it after a fire scare in my kitchen. Afterwards I was somewhat paranoid about fires so I bought this. It's about a foot tall, comes with a small metal that you can use for mounting to a wall, and a big sticker telling you where it is. I haven't needed to use it yet and I hope I don't have to. However, it's one of those things that you buy and hope you never use. I would recommend that if you got a few dollars to spare to buy this because it might save you or your house one day.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Discharged in Package, completely useless
customer_reviews.text: I opened the package and was hit in the face with a cloud of yellow powder. This was my first fire Extinguisher purchase and I had no idea what the powder was so I called poison control and learned the thing had completely discharged in the package. I wish I had read the other reviews more carefully because it looks like this is not an uncommon occurrence with this. Will not be buying from this company again. Amazon was fantastic though, and issued me a complete refund.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It simply didn't work when I needed it during a grill fire
customer_reviews.text: I just had an absolutely out of control grill fire. I ironically bought this a month ago. I ran to grab it and use it and it doesn't work. It just doesn't work. Dude this is life or death or home or no home. And it just doesn't work? I feel like I should sue this company. Anyways a bottle of water was more effective the second attempt. I can't return it at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Harry E. Nervino

customer_reviews.title: Probably OK, but not for ordering online
customer_reviews.text: The extinguisher arrived partially discharged. Whether this was due to Kidde's failure to pack it properly for transport, Amazon for not packing it well or UPS mishandling it, I can't say. To Amazon's credit, they gave me an immediate refund. But I decided to buy it in person from a brick-and-mortar store rather than opting for a replacement. Now I just have to decide what to do with the discharged on, since it's considered hazardous waste - maybe I can get it recharged.
customer_reviews.author: JerseyJohn

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Received extinguisher and removed from box, to find safety strap broken, pin removed from extinguisher and needs to be recharged, I RECEIVED IT EMPTY!!! Guess that won't put out any fires, and I am going on a trip this weekend and wanted it for my vehicle. Guess I will go buy another at a store where I can see the gauge.
customer_reviews.author: John E. MacKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Kidde pro 210 extinguisher faulty seal
customer_reviews.text: pull safety pin seal is broke on two units i purchased. very difficult to get replacement seals. in fire emergency you are supposed to pull on pin and the seal breaks and allows pin to release so extinguisher is ready to use. called the manufacturer Kidde and they said to get a hold of amazon. no luck there. do not use light plastic tie downs as you would have to have a wirecutter onhand to get pin out. i am not happy about this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce O.

customer_reviews.title: Performs well, great for professionals
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fire extinguisher for carrying in my car as a volunteer fire fighter. Some people buying extinguishers thankfully never need them but shortly after purchasing this extinguisher we were called to a motorcycle accident that had caught fire from the gasoline spilling out of the tank. When I got there this extinguisher after sitting in a hot car for a few weeks worked great to extinguish the fire, and unlike cheaper extinguishers this one was easily refillable at our local fire extinguisher distributor. It would be nice to have a slightly larger extinguisher at this price though, as it is only a 4lb one it does not last long in use.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron L.

customer_reviews.title: Industrial not Household
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize these have to be maintained regularly. That smaller chemical ones can be bought that are not as bulky and heavy. These are more for industrial use. I wanted three. One for my garage, by the furnace, and by the fire pit on the back porch. I kept my smaller ones in the car. I'm not sure single as I am how I am going to maintain these. I only mounted the one in the garage next to the kitchen. I got these after my smoke detectors went off...and replaced those as well...after twenty years! It became a project.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if this was used or just how it arrives?
customer_reviews.text: Received this just now - the safety pin was rattling around in the box (perhaps it just fell out), the factory seal UTFS yellow band was broken and not attached. I guess the pressure looks ok- is this how others have received this product? I set rating to 1 , will adjust if this is normal - but right now seems perhaps previously opened?
customer_reviews.author: Mango

customer_reviews.title: Not made very well, not worth the purchase price..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my Father, for Father's Day.It arrived with the contents from the canister, all over the box itself and with the pin free floating in the box. The pin wasn't secured properly and the contents came out.That shouldn't be possible, but the locking mechanism for this product didn’t work.The handle got pressed in shipping and the contents got sprayed inside the box. I'd look into another company, this wouldn't of happened if the product wasn't made with inferior hardware. This device is used to save lives and it’s not a good indication, that it would aid in that at all..
customer_reviews.author: TheIncredibleMan

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Just used this unit (which I purchased almost 6 years ago) to extinguish a small oven fire. Put out fire instantly with about a 1 second discharge which emptied the pressure of the extinguisher. I was surprised that I only got 1 second of discharge before empty but I assume that is probably because it was nearly empty after 6 years. Manufacturer says you should get 10-14 seconds of discharge. I replaced this with a larger 5lb extinguisher in case in the future I need more time to get the blaze under control + 2 x small canisters in case of a little kitchen fire.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Happy this one came with a 'Sticker'
customer_reviews.text: Needed to use an Extinguisher on a fire across the street recently and bought this and a few others to replace the one used. I would have used our other extinguishers, but we could not remember where to locate them. Running around the house, we looked right at the areas where they were... but did not see them. I like this one, because it came with a sticker that I posted to show 'Where' to find the extinguisher. This product is fine, and can be a life/property saver if needed. But I say to you all, get Extinguishers, but also post stickers pointing to where you can find them. Be safe all.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Torres

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.text: Our fireplace damper was stuck down so our living room was filling with smoke. We used this fire extinguisher to put out the small fireplace fire, but it would not shut off and filled our entire room with a huge mess of fire extinguisher dust... I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. It created a huge mess in our house. It should only spray when you need it to and it should shut off.
customer_reviews.author: jess

customer_reviews.title: Do You Have One by Your Bed?
customer_reviews.text: A surprising amount of people will buy a gun for their bedside but not a fire extinguisher. Yet you're much more likely to burn alive than get attacked by a burglar. Not that the latter can't happen, but you should play the odds. A fire extinguisher like this can help you get out of a sticky situation or get to a family member that needs to. This one is solid, sturdy, and will only need to be replaced every half decade or so.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W. Lehmann

customer_reviews.title: The fire was pretty big and it knocked it down giving the fire ...
customer_reviews.text: Every home owner should have one of these. I never needed one for years, then the neighbors from up north thought they could clear the woods behind the house with fire in our dry season. The fire was pretty big and it knocked it down giving the fire department the minutes they needed before it spread. Then a few months later a grease fire in the BBQ flared up and it put it out handily. Don't go cheap/small, get the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Charneski

customer_reviews.title: Its not real small but its sized right.
customer_reviews.text: We went with this size due to the idea of being over prepared is better than under. As for the function we have had no fire Thank God so We cant speak for that yet the gage 8says its full lol. It came Packed in a box kind of loose, but every thing looks good on it. It is kinda big so make sure you have room for it. It also came with a big sticker to identify its location if youre using this in a commercial setting.
customer_reviews.author: consumer

customer_reviews.title: YELLOW DUST-PIN DISENGAGED
customer_reviews.text: YEP!!!!IT HAPPENED TO ME TOO!! IGNORED THE COMMENTS ABOUT RECEIVING EXTINGUISHER IN RECHARGE AND YELLOW DUST EVERYWHERE...and that is exactly what I got. And to top it off the handle wad broken. FORGET IT!!!GOING TO LOWES TO BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Symmonee

customer_reviews.title: Large enough to do the job well.
customer_reviews.text: This extinguisher is perfect for a home or RV. Sized right for dealing with typical kitchen or other fires it's a vast improvement over smaller extinguishers and adequate to do the job! Mount the bracket to a stud or other firm surface, it's heavier than some and needs a firm mount to hang the extinguisher. It is rated for all common household fires and from experience I can attest to the wisdom of buying Kidde extinguishers.
customer_reviews.author: jack sink

customer_reviews.title: Hard to say for sure. I haven't had a ...
customer_reviews.text: Hard to say for sure. I haven't had a fire yet and hopefully won't. It doesn't look or feel cheap though. It came with a wall mounting bracket and a "Fire Extinguisher" sticker to place on the wall above it. Gives my garage a very industrial appeal. Here's to not dying in a house fire!
customer_reviews.author: Zach Kibbey

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, Recharging
customer_reviews.text: Brought First Alert 5 pound fire extinguisher to commercial fire protection shop. They would not recharge. Told that First Alert fire extinguisher has a poor hose connection that will not enable a reliable recharge. Offered an expensive small commercial fire extinguisher. Also told that Kidde has lesser expensive fire extinguishers that they will recharge. Found good price and delivery for a Kidde extinguisher from Amazon. Took almost a week to be delivered in Metro Washington, DC area that has dedicated Prime delivery trucks. Only disappointment was somewhat long delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Alkaline Guy

customer_reviews.title: Fire Extinguisher
customer_reviews.text: I like that this is refillable and has a visible pressure gauge. It is good for multiple kinds of fires: trash, paper, wood, liquids, and electrical. It is for low hazard places so it is safe for people. The contents are "four pounds of a multipurpose monoammonium phosphate dry chemical extinguishing agent" according to the blurb. I also like that it has a hose to make it easier to direct the spray. It has a 6 year shelf life and is a good price. I got one for my RV. I can be screwed to the wall. It's probably best to place it on a shelf or the floor because it is rather heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Retired and Traveling

customer_reviews.title: Nice size for home and garage.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these spread out in my garage and 2 in the house. Buying replacements today, because I used 2 of them on a grease fire. Worked flawlessly, saved the day. Can't recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must for every household kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, safe and secure. Provides a sense of safety at home. However, one has to be careful about the safety pin as it is easily dislodged increasing the possibility of accidental discharge. Other than that, I cannot comment further as I have been fortunate never to have used this extinguisher in a real fire scenario.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail Uddin

customer_reviews.title: Everyone Needs One of These!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my niece for this Christmas 2019 but I have one just like it. I think everyone needs one. I had to use mine once for the inside of the oven when my sister-in-law accidentally started a "small" fire. Good we had this. It immediately put out the small flames, the oven was saved, and the house stayed in tack. It could've been worse had we not had one of these.
customer_reviews.author: S. L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This fire extinguisher did exactly what it was supposed to do, it quickly and easily put out a small garage fire that could have turned into a disaster. I’m so grateful to have bought this fire extinguisher.
customer_reviews.author: Kaokelleeves

customer_reviews.title: Good find
customer_reviews.text: These were a great find and easy to get. A lot of other sites charge way more for shipping because the extinguishers are so heavy. But with prime I had no issue getting them in two days. We use these up in our cabin where there are lots of wood stoves and camp fires. You can never be too safe with fire and with the California drought all vegetation is a risk with fire. Will buy again when we need a new one for our home too. They were easy for my husband to hang and we even put one on a redwood by a campfire for safety reasons.
customer_reviews.author: girlypantsTop Contributor: Korean Beauty Products

customer_reviews.title: Received Old - 1/3 of life expired.
customer_reviews.text: This extinguisher is insurance rated to be used for 6 years per label on the nozzle. It's lifespan is determined by the year date on the bottom. In June of 2020, we received an extinguisher from 2018! One-third gone on receipt. Returned it. Hello big box store where I can check the dates before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Gentle Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great for home or car
customer_reviews.text: Bought a couple of these for my house after going through fire brigade training and seeing in person just how fast a fire can destroy absolutely everything. Good size for smaller areas, but just keep in mind most of these extinguishers only have a small amount of material in them; a few seconds at most. If you have a larger area or are in an area with higher fire risk, I would recommend a bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: skipjack_clipper

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, go with another fire extinguisher brand
customer_reviews.text: Like all the other negative reviews, my unit arrived damaged and fully discharged. Yellow powder everywhere when I opened the box. There's a reason this extinguisher is cheaper than the others on amazon; 'Kidde' packs their products like crap. Buy from another brand.
customer_reviews.author: E. Borders

customer_reviews.title: Can you put a price on safety?
customer_reviews.text: Priced decently and arrived quickly. Easily mounts to wall. Hope to never use it. Have two of these and two smaller ones in my house. Are you prepared to have a small controllable fire end up destroying your house? Then, do not buy this item. $100 worth of fire extinguishers may save me thousands in deductibles and many months of agony. Good investment IMO. Kidde is a trusted brand.
customer_reviews.author: Molon Labe

customer_reviews.title: Fire Extinguisher
customer_reviews.text: I use these like insurance. I figure if I am prepared for something negative to happen it won't happen. I have one of these extinguishers in the garage, one in the kitchen, and one in my bedroom just in case but I have never had to use one. If I didn't have them I would have probably needed one. It's like a parachute in that if you ever need one and don't have one you will probably never need one again.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Small General Purpose Fire Extinguisher
customer_reviews.text: A local fire department suggested that a fire extinguisher of this size for bedrooms and similar areas should be on hand for non-grease fires. Except for reading instructions and putting it in the garage in the right location, I have not had to use it. It has a metal nozzle so recharge down the line should be possible.
customer_reviews.author: Joe T Peg

customer_reviews.title: It's a fire extinguisher.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived. I hope I don't have to use it. The pros: The gauge is easy to read It comes with a sign you can hang to indicate where the fire extinguisher is It comes with a wall mounting bracket It is red It pretty much looks exactly like a fire extinguisher The cons: The handle is a little cheap, but my guess is that for the one time I might need it it won't matter as long as it goes off... I guess I'll update this if I ever need to use it
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: This is disposable not rechargeable
customer_reviews.text: The description said this was rechargeable but it isn't. It's a small disposable fire extinguisher, or at least that is what I received. It's not returnable so I had to call Amazon about it.
customer_reviews.author: epheme

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: A good deal for what you get, the one I received did not read out a full charge, was in the lower 1/3 of the green, it was made In 2018. I expected to see the charge dead center in the green, that’s my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Gibson

customer_reviews.title: When I needed it, it worked!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to have in the apt “just in case.” Turned out I unexpectedly needed it when a fire accidentally broke out while a candle was lit... caused by the Gf ironically lol. Anyways, ran for this and it did the job and saved the day. Worked when I needed it. Put out the small fire and was easy to use. Def 5 star!
customer_reviews.author: Sliderguy

customer_reviews.title: This does not come with anything to mount it to drywall!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely unhappy as I have to go out and buy hardware to mount this myself. Maybe they should list that in the description. My advice buy another that comes with the screws and mounting hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Baer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: A well constructed fire extinguisher, much better then the little cheapo cylinder with plastic handles that I've had for years. Kidde is a good brand, so I have confidence that it will perform when the time comes. My only complaint is that they ship it limited quantity of hazardous material, which I wasn't aware of, and when it arrived on my porch I got excited because I thought it was a shipment of ammunition that I thought I had forgotten about. Imagine my disappointment when I noticed it was a fire extinguisher. What a tease. Ask joking aside, I'm happy with this and feel protected from light household fits again.
customer_reviews.author: HandyDan

customer_reviews.title: A good Kidde.
customer_reviews.text: How do you rate a fire extinguisher that you haven't used? Well, I have used a Kidde Extinguisher before and it saved my bacon. When I caught my studio on fire I used a commercial grade Kidde (that I had purchased just a few months earlier to replace the "acid" type) to put it out. The "all metal" construction is a mark of quality along with the metal to metal connection between the nozzle and body of the unit. It is rechargeable, so I will be able to reuse it if I survive the first use. The gauge is readable and I hope accurate. It is also NOT made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Chascopp

customer_reviews.title: Gives me peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: I installed 2 of these bad boys in my car which may be too much but it's better to be safe than sorry. Very high quality fire extinguishers. Would totally buy them again when these 2 expires.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle ShoeBoi

customer_reviews.title: Defective!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just pulled this out to hang it up and there is powder all over the inside of the box and the gauge says needs recharged. Glad I pulled it out of box before we needed it. Wish it was within return period.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Good Price!!!!A Necessity!
customer_reviews.text: Big,short & lightly heavy. 'lasts 13 to fifteen secs., But it's got a lot of chemicals, etc, in it. I'm glad to have it in my kitchen, & I bet others are, too!!!Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Saltydog

customer_reviews.title: Old Extinguisher being dumped with old expiration date
customer_reviews.text: It's the middle of 2019 and the extinguisher has a production date of 2017. Now when the fire marshal visits our business I will be required to get it inspected for about $15. And the date is only good for 6 years before it has to go or be recharged. A 2 year old extinguisher is already past 1/3 of it's life when I received it. Not a good value. I should have just bought it from Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Geller

customer_reviews.title: Arrived discharged
customer_reviews.text: They arrived discharged. Created a horrible mess. Nearly no packaging in the boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Kidde Quality, But a ZIP Tie Holding Securing Pin
customer_reviews.text: Name brand home fire extinguisher, with good price. I like this size for home protection and the gauge makes keeping up with charge sure and easy. The extinguisher came with a zip tie securing the pin which takes far more than the recommended 3 lbs pressure to break. Had I not noticed and replaced, it could have cost precious seconds in case of fire.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Seems like good quality Fire Extinguisher
customer_reviews.text: arrive in good shape. Manufacture date is 2016 so this is a new item. and needle point straight in the middle of the green triangle so this is properly charged. Comes with a mounting bracket and 'escape' arrow sign. Also with a tag for inspections. The head and all the important parts are metal not cheap plastic. PS: Per instructions this size will be good for about 15 seconds of use.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Feels Solid
customer_reviews.text: Way heavier than expected and seems like it will do the job when it comes down to it. I can't test it without ruining it, but I have confidence in this extinguisher. I like that it's multipurpose. If a fire breaks out, I don't wanna have to remember if my extinguisher will only make it worse!
customer_reviews.author: TypicalRhino14

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: When Kidde had the massive recall on their extinguishers they replaced 3 of mine. That gave me confidence in them again, so I've since bought 3-4 more for around the house, shop, and in the cars. Can't be too careful. Kidde now has a quality product with a good valve, at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Herrington

customer_reviews.title: I hope you never need it, this is higher capacity if you do.
customer_reviews.text: One old extinguisher out in the shed had lost pressure and needed to be replaced, while the one I keep in the house near the woodstove still looked fine but I deemed it to be too small after research. I think this is a good size to have in the event you need some sustained fire-fighting capability. I hope it never happens, but I feel better to be prepared. The company appears to be very responsive. I recently was contacted by them about a potential problem - underpressurization - for two smaller units I purchased for the cellar and mancave, and they sent replacements right out.
customer_reviews.author: Black Hole Gang

customer_reviews.title: Appears to work fine - Hope I never have to use this.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to reduce my insurance costs. I haven't had to use it and hope I never will. It arrived on time and shows full pressure. It also comes with a mounting adapter to mount to a wall if needed which is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold a charge, two years after purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fire extinguisher in December of 2016. Less than two years later (9/27/2018) the charge needle is midway between empty and the green area on the gauge. I've never discharged it and the factory seal is still in place. Very disappointment with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Inspires confidence
customer_reviews.text: How do you rate a fire extinguisher without actually having used it on a fire? I gave it five stars on the basis of its solid construction, excellent yet simple instructions, its very appearance which inspires confidence, and the fact that I have seen this same model in doctors' offices and other businesses, which means probably that it was recommended or chosen by their insurance inspectors. I hope I never have occasion to report how it performs in use.
customer_reviews.author: Jim R.

customer_reviews.title: I hope it works
customer_reviews.text: It’s a fire extinguisher, what can I say. Until you have a fire you don’t know how good this will be. Hopefully I’ll never need it
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I have seen these for as little as $39 with free shipping. I like that the Kidde pro extinguisher is aluminum, metal, corrosion resistant, class A,B,C, and rechargeable/refillable! We mount them on the kitchen walls of our rentals for ease of access. They have a gauge which idicates when they need recharged, also making it easy to see if you do get a dud. I learned after I bought them that Fire Departments supply and recommend rechargeable extinguishers over the disposable junk out there. Our fire department Tests for free and has nominal recharge/refill fees.
customer_reviews.author: Masch

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but necessary
customer_reviews.text: Pro: correct model for KS dc licensing, easy to read gauge, lightweight Con: price Note: I’ve not had to use it
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Came completely discharged.
customer_reviews.text: There was no charge in this thing when it arrived. I called a local fire station and they said they never heard of a new extinguisher with no charge and recommend I return it. When I inquired about getting it charged, they said that charging it would be just as much if not more than the extinguisher costs.
customer_reviews.author: stankmasterflex

customer_reviews.title: Feel Safer As Soon As It Arrives!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for months and the safety I feel with it in my home has already so, so much more than paid for itself. Make sure everyone knows exactly where it is. I recommend close to but not in the kitchen. That's where the first is the most likely to start and you don't need to be running with your ass on fire to grab the extinguisher.
customer_reviews.author: BostonsPhotos

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a good quality product!
customer_reviews.text: I attached mine to a stud in the basement which was pretty easy. Package includes a large sticker for your wall. If the item really works as expected can of course only be determined when I need to use it. I hope I don’t ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Olli Ba

customer_reviews.title: but they seem to be a good product so far
customer_reviews.text: It's a shame fire extinguishers are so expensive. I bought three of these. One for my house, one for my girlfriend's house, and one to keep in the toolbox of my truck. I have not had to use these thank God, but they seem to be a good product so far.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Just go to Lowe’s.
customer_reviews.text: Finally took it out of the box and the charge is low. Barely within green. Not good for a brand new extinguisher.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Got a bad one. Opened box. No pin. Retardant powder everywhere. Chucked it right in the trash and bought another one at a brick and mortar store.
customer_reviews.author: Double D

customer_reviews.title: A must have for every home
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have in every home. I purchased two of these one for the kitchen and one for the bedrooms. Came with all the mounting hardware, even in a very large sticker to put on the wall I assume for commercial application.
customer_reviews.author: Smalls*

customer_reviews.title: Poor QC
customer_reviews.text: This was the replacement for the original I purchased (which came deployed and covered myself and my kitchen in yellow powder that made me cough for a week). While the replacement was not deployed the safety ring as well the lock were displaced and broken.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hope Not to Use
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two for our home, a requirement for foster care. I hope not to use them but am grateful to have them since I have had to use them a few times before. They are a decent size and easily stored.
customer_reviews.author: C&L Corbett

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for use in oven!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this abc fire extinguisher for the kitchen because I thought it could be used for all types of fires. The first thing I read in the instructions provided was that this fire extinguisher is not recommended for oven fires because the chemical agent is likely to ruin an oven. This should have been clearly noted in the specifications. I suspect a lot of these are sold for the kitchen and most individuals don't realize it will ruin the oven until it's too late. I am giving the fire extinguisher two stars because it cannot be used for the purpose I had intended.
customer_reviews.author: JimG

customer_reviews.title: Home safety at low costs
customer_reviews.text: Great to have in case of fire. Small investment to save alot. Have at least one on each floor. If unsure stop at local firehouse and evaluate needs. Stay with reputable manfacturer.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: Looks good so far
customer_reviews.text: This might be the only thing I have purchased on Amazon that I hope I never use. It's well put together and all metal. Do yourself a favor and don't get a plastic one. I like the huge "fire extinguisher" sticker that comes with it. Easy to mount as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Gillihan

customer_reviews.title: Goes off easily if not well secured in trunk
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it would work really well, just make sure it is secured well. I purchased a velcro support system which did not hold up under G forces in my trunk. Seems to me it should not go off due to rolling around in the trunk though, but obviously it did. What a mess!
customer_reviews.author: AndrewAustin

customer_reviews.title: safety first
customer_reviews.text: Got this fire extinguisher for a second home. Larger and greater capacity than most kitchen fire extinguishers. Good ratings and brand reputation, along with price, were my guides. Fortunately I have not had to use this extinguisher on an actual fire so I cannot comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: great value for the money. Needed to get a few of these for one of my retail stores to meet insurance requirements. Inspector passed us without any hassle. The price delivered was actually slightly cheaper than Costco so I'm pretty happy all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: Razorwoods

customer_reviews.title: Similar to others, mine arrived already discharged
customer_reviews.text: The product looked great via the specs and felt professional, but similar to some other reviews, mine arrived covered in yellow extinguisher dust in the box and the gauge read that it needed to be recharged. Can't really give a high review for something that doesn't arrive ready to use!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Every house should have
customer_reviews.text: Don't say I want to find out the effectiveness of this when the situation comes, but it's reassuring to have a little more extra safety than those tiny small extinguishers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Release Pin Broke Loose in Box
customer_reviews.text: Second Kiddie extinguisher I have purchased where out of the box the release pin retention tie was broken; luckily the extinguisher did not discharge in transit!
customer_reviews.author: AJK

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: Thought I'd never use this, but my wife was making dinner and toaster oven caught on fire, put it out immediatly would totally recommend this item, buying another one as we speak.
customer_reviews.author: anthony rocco

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how long this canister will last. When ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how long this canister will last. When I received it, the pressure needle in the gauge was barely in the 'good' area.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie R.

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: The mount was easy to attach to the wall. I feel safer having it in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by my firefighter neighbor.
customer_reviews.text: My firefighter neighbor recommended so I figured I couldn’t be wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What can I say, its a fire extinguisher that ...
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, its a fire extinguisher that works on electrical, gas, and chemical fires within the home. We had a kitchen fire and if it had not been for the purchase of one of these, the fire might have gotten out of control. Now, It's a must. I have fire extinguishers for the kitchen, family room, and an upstairs room with computer equipment. We also have fire alarms in various places.
customer_reviews.author: Bennie

customer_reviews.title: Kidde Brand, Recommended size for home
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to be a good product for home safety and fire extinguishing protection. Have not been disappointed with Kidde and local fire department recommended it.
customer_reviews.author: Don M.

customer_reviews.title: Safety first
customer_reviews.text: Not fun to purchase, but important to have in a home. The peace of mind afforded by this fire extinguisher is well worth the money, knowing it may help keep my family and home safe one day
customer_reviews.author: Cory Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I hope never to have the ability to review how effective it is.
customer_reviews.text: But so far, it isn't blowing up or leaking or otherwise causing a nuisance, so I'm awarding it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: David Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE YOU CAN'T RETURN THIS ITEM.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived disgusting and covered in fire extinguishing material the extinguisher was also empty and entirely discharged the powder was all over to the packaging outside and inside and made a mess I would not recommend this extinguisher at all. THE PRODUCT IS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR RETURN I
customer_reviews.author: B. Patel

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for Every Floor in Your Home
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hang. (Comes with a hanger.) I can rest easy that an extinguisher is nearby if needed to put out a small fire.
customer_reviews.author: Yoyo C

customer_reviews.title: its a fire extinguisher
customer_reviews.text: glad i haven't had to use it yet - hope it will work if ever I need it to !
customer_reviews.author: Gary F. Galletta

customer_reviews.title: IT IS JUST PERFECT FOR A KITCHEN
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY I REMEMBERED TO BUY THESE!!!! HOPRFULLY I WILL NEVER HAVE TO USE IT, BUT ITS NOT THOSE LITTLE TINY ONES, IT IS JUST PERFECT FOR A KITCHEN. IT IS LARGE ENOUGH TO PUT OUT A FIRE WITHOUT FEAR IF OH MY, IS THIS GOING GO RUN OUT BEFORE I CAN GET THIS FIRE OUT??? I FEEL VERY COMFORTABLE KNOWING I HAVE ONE ON EACH FLOOR. LOVE IT, LOVE THE SIZE OF IT!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary H.  Blake

customer_reviews.title: Came on time and as described.
customer_reviews.text: Came on time and as described. Haven't used yet and I hope I never will, so its hard to speak on whether or not it works.
customer_reviews.author: Lino412

customer_reviews.title: Recommended at least one for every household
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Portable as ready for use. Hopefully, we will never have to test its effectiveness, but we feel a bit more secure that it is available, if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Heart & Soul Concerts

customer_reviews.title: makes me feel safer
customer_reviews.text: my apartment didn't hav ea fire extinguisher so i bought one. makes me feel betterz
customer_reviews.author: Deven Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have a fire extinguisher!
customer_reviews.text: I had never used a fire extinguisher, and I bought this because we have a new baby in the house. A month later, we had an electrical fire. Big flames up the back side of our house! The extinguisher put it out. It was actually still in the original packaging in my garage. The fire moved so fast... if we had waited for the fire department, it would have been a lot worse.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M.

customer_reviews.title: Compact Extinguisher for the home
customer_reviews.text: Nice and compact extinguisher to have hands for any emergency. Easy to operate and store.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas G. Mariano

customer_reviews.title: Company doesn't stand behind their products!
customer_reviews.text: The item I bought was recalled for a defect by the manufacturer. I was sent information to file a claim and did so. Despite contacting the manufacturer a couple of times regarding their promised replacement, none was ever sent and no follow-up notice was provided. The fire extinguisher has a known trigger malfunction...not like it's could cause a life-death issue!!
customer_reviews.author: Living in ID

customer_reviews.title: Overall great quality but had one major flaw
customer_reviews.text: When I got it, I opened the package to find that, despite the packing to prevent any damage, the extinguisher was mildly discharged, leaving yellow powder in all of its contents. While I decided to keep it and just clean it and hang it up, the yellow zip tie that would've kept the pin in place for easy removal had ripped and the pin was in the bottom of the box. I'm not entirely sure how a zip tie actually breaks in its box, but the mess from the opening of the box was enough to warrant a negative review from me.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: A product so nice I had to buy it twice!
customer_reviews.text: Showed up as expected, well packaged and looks sturdy. I haven't had to use it yet. Kinda hope I never do. But I get the feeling it'll be up to the challenge. Hopefully I will too.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought for gift, they luved it and were pleased w/ it.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzer

customer_reviews.title: Damaged!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived discharged in the box. What a mess! Got a refund.
customer_reviews.author: William Morris

customer_reviews.title: Had to recharge it after six months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it's big enough to offer adequate protection and rechargeable. I wasn't expecting to have to recharge it six months after I bought it without ever using it, which was pretty disappointing. Recharge is another $45 at my local company. Hopefully I never have to write about using it in a house fire, but I'm glad it's around.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel LeBoeuf

product_meta.title: Kidde 21005779 Pro 210 Fire Extinguisher, ABC, 160CI, 4 lbs, 1 Pack
product_meta.description:
Size Name:1 Pack| Pattern Name:Fire ExtinguisherKidde 21005779 Pro 210 Fire Extinguisher, ABC, 160CI, 4 lbs, 1 Pack.

AMAZON.COM




A multipurpose fire extinguisher for your home or business, the Kidde Pro 210 (model No. 21005779) is fitted with a pressure gauge that provides an at-a-glance status, and it features a lightweight aluminum cylinder and sturdy chrome-plated brass valve assembly.



FEATURES
The Kidde Pro 210 is suitable for use on Class A (trash, wood, and paper), Class B (liquids and gases), and Class C (energized electrical equipment) fires. It's ideal for protecting your home as well as low-hazard occupancies such as offices, churches, assembly halls, classrooms, and hotel guest areas. This rechargeable unit contains four pounds of a multipurpose monoammonium phosphate dry chemical extinguishing agent. It has a discharge time of 13 to 15 seconds, a discharge range of 10 to 15 feet, and an operating pressure of 100 PSI.



The seamless aluminum cylinder is powder coated for corrosion protection, and it measures 4.5 inches in diameter and 15.7 inches tall. Assembled in Mexico from globally sourced components, it's backed by a six-year limited warranty. It comes with a plastic hanger, and it is Coast Guard (U.S.C.G.) approved when fitted with an optional mounting bracket.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
One Kidde Pro 210 fire extinguisher, one plastic hanger, and operating instructions.








FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The PRO210 is fitted with a pressure gauge that provides at-a-glance status and is manufactured from lightweight aluminum cylinder and sturdy chrome plated brass valve assembly. Suitable for use on Class A (trash, wood and paper), Class B (liquids and gases) and Class C (energized electrical equipment) fires. A 2A10BC rated extinguisher is required for protecting LOW hazard occupancies such as: living areas of the home, offices, churches, assembly halls, classrooms, and hotel guest areas. Unit contains 4 lbs of multipurpose monoammonium phosphate dry chemical extinguishing agent. This is a rechargeable unit that comes with a plastic hanger. This unit is Coast Guard (U.S.C.G.) approved when fitted with optional mounting bracket (Kidde pt #466400). Features bilingual (Spanish) nameplate and carton. Re-chargeable. Six year limited warranty. UL listed 2A10BC.

See more
feature_bullets: Multipurpose protection: Fights Class A, B, and C fires and is UL rated 2-A:10-B:C
Easy to read: Gauge tells you when fire extinguisher is charged and ready for use
Light weight: Durable corrosion resistant aluminum cylinder
Clear instruction label: Shows the steps required to operate the extinguisher
Quick and powerful: Discharge time of 13 to 15 seconds, a discharge range of 10 to 15 feet, and an operating pressure of 100 PSI
Multipurpose dry chemical; Fights all types of fire (trash, wood, paper, liquids, electrical equipment)
Pressure gauge allows for immediate pressure status check
Powder coated aluminum cylinder for corrosion protection
Rechargeable; Wall hanger included; Net agent weight 4 pounds
Meets the requirements of Underwriters Laboratories (UL), an independent facility that tests products for compliance with widely-accepted safety standards
